incidents.name: Problems Loading Dashboard & Elevated Builds Error Rate

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have applied a fix and are seeing recovery across builds and dashboard. We are continuing to monitor.
We have identified the issue and begun applying a fix. We are beginning to see partial recovery across builds and parts of the dashboard. We will provide additional updates as they become available.
We are investigating elevated dashboard load times and error rates on builds. We will provide updates as they become available.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are investigating delays in firewall observability appearing on the dashboard. We will provide additional updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated Errors on API & Dashboard, Delayed Builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring results.

We are continuing to investigate this issue.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates in sin1 (Singapore) Edge Region

incident_updates.body: There were elevated error rates in the sin1 (Singapore) edge region between 08:57 and 09:04 UTC. The issue has been resolved, and all systems are operating normally.

incidents.name: Elevated git clone duration at build time

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The new build routing has addressed the issue. We are monitoring the results.
We have mitigated the impact of the underlying issue by moving builds from pdx1 to iad1 while we continue to investigate the underlying cause.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Weâ€™ve confirmed the issue is intermittent, and redeploying a failed build may succeed. 

Alternatively, as a temporary workaround, builds can be run locally and deployed as prebuilt output using Vercel CLI:
`vercel build && vercel deploy --prebuilt`

We are currently observing elevated `git clone` durations on a subset of builds. Some builds are taking significantly longer than expected to clone repositories, resulting in slower overall build start times. 

We are actively analyzing clone performance metrics and infrastructure behavior to identify the root cause.

incidents.name: Elevated Connection Latency in dub1 (Dublin, Ireland) Edge Region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved, and traffic has been fully routed back to the dub1 region.
A fix has been implemented and we have routed traffic back to dub1. We are actively monitoring the results.
We have rerouted all dub1 Edge region traffic as of 17:15 UTC, and traffic should no longer see increased latency. We are continuing to work on a fix to restore traffic back to dub1.
The dub1 Edge traffic is currently being rerouted to the nearest Edge region (lhr1) to mitigate the impact. We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have identified elevated connection latency and intermittent timeouts affecting serving traffic in the dub1 Edge region. A fix is currently being rolled out.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating reports of delayed metrics for Observability, Speed Insights, Web Analytics, Usage, and Audit Logs. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Runtime logs not showing in Dashboard

incident_updates.body: A change was merged to the Vercel dashboard that introduced a bug in the query for runtime logs in some situations. Upon being alerted, the dashboard was rolled back, which restored the ability to see runtime logs. The change was then reverted. Data was still being collected and no logs are missing.
